item.title: [Fixed] 498 Arios Client help with eclipse
item.dc:creator: @Kyle-Billni Kyle-Billni
item.description:
@Kyle-Billni wrote:

Okay so I did this semi tutorial from @Bl3nd [quote=“Bl3nd, post:18, topic:547098”]Open up Eclipse, go New>New Project (click on Use Default Location)>Browse (find your client folder)>Finish. Done.

Once you’ve done that, right click on the project>Run As>Run Configurations…>Right click on Java Application>New>Fill in the Name>In the Main class: Hit Search, then choose the Client class>Go to Arguments tab>Enter this: 10 0 lowmem members 32 (if you want highmem, then just switch lowmem to highmem)>Apply>Run. It should run with no problems…[/quote] this is what my run configurations looks like (Main - Arguments) but when I run it I get this

[2014-12-18 21:40:48][Arios]: Launching game client... Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "lowmem" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at org.arios.GameLaunch.main(GameLaunch.java:45) ) I don’t know what I am doing wrong, I really hope someone will help me with this since I really want to try this out thanks to anyone who knows how to fix this and helps me out.

Edit: The GameLauncher.java [spoiler][code][code=java5]package org.arios;

import java.awt.Frame;

import org.arios.jagex.Game;
import org.arios.logger.Logger;

/**

  • Represents the main class of the client.

  • @author Arios
    */
    public final class GameLaunch {

    /**

    • The default name.
      */
      private static final String DEFAULT_NAME = “Arios”;

    /**

    • Represents the {@link GameSetting} of this game.
      */
      private static final GameSetting SETTINGS = new GameSetting(DEFAULT_NAME, null, 1, “live”, false);

    /**

    • The main method.
    • @param args the arguments casted on runtime.
      */
      public static void main(String… args) {
      Logger.log(“Launching game client…”);
      GameSetting settings = SETTINGS;
      if (args.length > 0) {
      if (args.length < 4) {
      System.err.println(“Invalid arguments specified - usage: ip_address live/office/local world_id lowmem/highmem port(optional)”);
      return;
      }
      String address = args[0].toLowerCase();
      String ip = address;
      if (address.equals(“localhost”)) {
      ip = “127.0.0.1”;
      }
      else if (address.equals(“gameip”)) {
      ip = SETTINGS.getIp();
      }
      String environment = args[1];
      int worldId = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
      boolean lowMemory = args[3].equals(“lowmem”);
      if (args.length > 4) {
      Configurations.SERVER_PORT = Integer.parseInt(args[4]);
      }
      settings = new GameSetting(DEFAULT_NAME, ip, worldId, environment, lowMemory);
      }
      Game.create(settings).launch(new Frame());
      }

    /**

    • Gets the settings.
    • @return the setting
      */
      public static GameSetting getSetting() {
      return SETTINGS;
      }
      }[/code][/code][/spoiler] Also this is what is highlighted when I open the GameLauncher.java

Thanks everyone for the help, I fixed it with someones help.
